Duo_Maxwell

April 25, 2005 | On Feb. 16, 2000, Matthew Limon gave his boyfriend a blow job and got himself a 17-year prison sentence. The boys were residents at the Lakemary Center, a school for developmentally delayed youngsters in Paola, Kan. It's generous, perhaps, to call them boyfriends. What they did was more akin to sexual experimentation, two boys in a dormitory at night, messing around. Matthew had just turned 18 the week before, and his partner was just shy of his 15th birthday. The younger boy, identified only as M.A.R., consented to the sex, but changed his mind. As soon as he asked Matthew to stop, Matthew did, and M.A.R. has always been steadfast in his statement that what happened was consensual. How the police were brought in, why they were called, isn't clear. Someone from the center complained and the trial was based on stipulated facts -- one paragraph stating that on that night in February, the boys engaged in consensual oral sex. That single paragraph was the basis for the 17-year sentence.

 
 http://www.salon.com/mwt/col/waldman/2005/04/25/limon/index_np.html

post_info.post_title: have oral sex, go to Jail

Jo Bennett

If they were both developmentally delayed, then it seems bizarre to lock one of them up. The sentence certainly seems excessive. That said, in normal circumstances an eighteen year old involved in a sex act with a 15 year old has some pretty fast talking to do. Difficult to know without knowing more details of the boys developmental states.
 
 EDIT: that fact that he'd have got off pretty lightly had his partner been female does tend to tip the balance in his favour. That said, personally I still think it's a pretty big age gap for teenagers.

having sex with anyone less than 15 years old is statutory rape in most states, if not all.
 there is no consensual sex with a minor.

having sex with anyone less than 15 years old is statutory rape in most states, if not all.

 I think some states have degrees tho. Like an 18 yr old with a 15 yr old may not considered such - but a 25 yr old with a 15 year would be...
daewoo

In Ks we have soem pretty rough laws RE statuatory rape. The fact the guy was 18 is what got him in trouble, since otherwise he would have been charged with a minor. It would not have mattered if it was a girl. Our laws are just like that here.
 
 Last year, 2 15 yr old kids got caught having sex. BOTH were charged with statuatory rape and both are in juvenile detention centers until they turn 18.
 
 Here, the legal age of consent is 16, and they take it SERIOUSLY.
 
 While this article is certianly a good example of how strict our laws are in Ks regarding statuatory rape, I can honestly say that I seriously doubt the court gave a longer sentence than they would have if it had been a male and a female.
Kuato

The fact that he stopped when asked shows this was not a coercion situation.
 
 Lighter penalties for opposite sex occurrences (per the article) point to the court's opinion of homosexuality. 17 years vs 15 months is outrageous.
daewoo

What you have here is an 18 yr old getting freaky with a 14 yr old. We are just a bunch of dumb farmers in kansas, but that is NOT OK with us. I know that some other places that is considered perfectly acceptable. Here it is not. 
 
 I think the ACLU and the gay rights folks need to interview their poster children a little better before trying to make a public statement, because in Ks, we unseal juvenile records for purposes of felony sentencing until you are 25.
 
 Do you think the ACLU was surprised to find that this was the guys THIRD sex related charge, the first two being aggravated criminal sodomy, and neither of them was even arguably consensual? He had essentially been sentenced to the center in Paola instead of prison.
 
 Regardles of whether the romeo and juliete law would have applied or not, this was his third sex crime in 5 years, all felonies (the R&J laws in KS do not remove it to a misdemeanor). We are funny about things like that. We generally feel that sexual predators should be restrained rather than wandering around in public. 
 
 This actually upset me enought to make some calls. Apparently he was not already in prison becuse someboduy along the wway felt sorry for him becuase he was mildly retarded, so instead of locking him up for 10 years on the second offense, they sent him to a home. 
 
 So, yes, he is going to spend the next chunk of his life in prison. No, I do not feel sorry for him, and when he gets out, he will be supervised for 5 years, not be allowed to live near a school or day care, will have to register a sa sexual offender. This is what we do with sexual predators here. I have no apologies.

 I think the ACLU and the gay rights folks need to interview their poster children a little better before trying to make a public statement, because in Ks, we unseal juvenile records for purposes of felony sentencing until you are 25.

 
 That is not the point. If you feel so strongly about the issue, then all people that commit the same crime regardless of orientation should serve the longer sentence. It is inherently unfair that someone who committed the same crime as others is serving far more time than those people soley based on the gender of the victim. There is no excuse for that. 
 
 The problem has never been limited to the "dumb farmers of Kansas" as you put it. Even the libertine hedonists of the northeast have had similar issues.

The sentence to me is appropriate, maybe it should even be longer for men who prey on young boys..........
Diogenes99

The sentence to me is appropriate, maybe it should even be longer for men who prey on young boys..........
It wouldn't be long enough here in Montana. Some years back, our legislature passed a <snicker< "truth in sentencing" bill -- for every day served, the convict gets one day off for good behavior; and he/she is eligible for parole at half of the reduced time. So, take the judge's sentence and divide by 4. The Kansas sentence of 17 years would put the guy back on the street in 4 years and 3 months up here.
 
 On the other hand, we do encourage them to leave the area after release. One fellow who killed and ate a social worker here back in the seventies was released after 10 years and moved to the (solidly blue) Twin Cities area.
